client_id.title: Client ID
client_id.description: The Client ID of your Google Analytics developer application.

client_secret.title: Client Secret
client_secret.description: The Client Secret of your Google Analytics developer application.

refresh_token.title: Refresh Token
refresh_token.description: The token for obtaining a new access token.

access_token.title: Access Token
access_token.description: Access Token for making authenticated requests.

credentials_json.title: Service Account JSON Key
credentials_json.description: The JSON key linked to the service account used for authorization. For steps on obtaining this key, refer to the setup guide.

property_id.title: Property ID
property_id.description: The Property ID is a unique number assigned to each property in Google Analytics, found in your GA4 property URL. This ID allows the connector to track the specific events associated with your property. Refer to the Google Analytics documentation to locate your property ID.

date_ranges_start_date.title: Start Date
date_ranges_start_date.description: The start date from which to replicate report data in the format YYYY-MM-DD. Data generated before this date will not be included in the report. Not applied to custom Cohort reports.

custom_reports.title: Custom Reports
custom_reports.description: A JSON array describing the custom reports you want to sync from Google Analytics. See the documentation for more information about the exact format you can use to fill out this field.

window_in_days.title: Data Request Interval (Days)
window_in_days.description: The interval in days for each data request made to the Google Analytics API. A larger value speeds up data sync, but increases the chance of data sampling, which may result in inaccuracies. We recommend a value of 1 to minimize sampling, unless speed is an absolute priority over accuracy. Acceptable values range from 1 to 364. Does not apply to custom Cohort reports. More information is available in the documentation.
